header_summary:
Bitcoin's quest for enhanced transaction privacy has led to the development of the Payjoin transaction method and its more advanced counterpart, Octojoin. Octojoin, which is detailed on its [official page](https://octojoin.github.io/), allows users to merge multiple inputs into a single transaction, making it significantly more challenging for on-chain analysts to trace the ownership of these inputs. This method not only boosts privacy by obfuscating the transaction trail but also introduces novel functionalities like swaps and the selling of statecoins, further enriching Bitcoin's ecosystem.

The release of Bitcoin Core version 26.2, as announced on [Bitcoin Core's website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-26.2/), marks a pivotal update featuring enhancements in user experience, system efficiency, and a suite of new features including improved translations for global users. This version underscores the importance of community collaboration in the ongoing development and stability of Bitcoin, facilitating a more inclusive and efficient platform for users worldwide.

Innovations in blockchain cryptography have been highlighted by the introduction of the LS-LSAG scheme, a new logarithmic-size ring signature scheme detailed at [https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/921](https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/921). This advancement proposes a more size-efficient alternative to traditional signatures, optimizing space without compromising security, and represents a significant leap forward for blockchain technologies aiming for enhanced scalability and privacy.

The Bitcoin Lightning Network (LN) discussion around Fiat channels and Tony's construction illustrates the diverse strategies within the ecosystem aimed at improving transactional efficiency and user autonomy. While Fiat channels offer a custodial solution with proof of misbehavior, Tony's construction remains non-custodial, emphasizing direct asset control and integration of BTC and USD channels for seamless currency exchanges. Concurrently, the concept of cluster linearization emerges as a promising method to refine Bitcoin Core's performance, particularly in managing the mempool by organizing transactions into clusters, thereby streamlining various network operations and paving the way for more efficient and scalable blockchain technologies.

recent_posts.title: Octojoin: Payjoin with no interaction between sender and recipient
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin developers face challenges in maintaining transaction privacy.
- Octojoin proposes a solution, enhancing privacy by blending inputs from multiple users.
- It aims to improve swaps usage and offers a platform for selling statecoins.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 26.2 released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 26.2 introduces new features, bug fixes, and global translations.
- Upgrade advises shutdown of old version; installation varies by operating system.
- Release includes script, peer-to-peer network changes, and acknowledges contributors.

recent_posts.title: A new logarithmic-size signature scheme LS-LSAG
recent_posts.summary:
- Ed Hughes introduced a novel logarithmic-size ring signature scheme, LS-LSAG.
- LS-LSAG offers significant improvements in size efficiency over traditional LSAG/CLSAG signatures.
- This scheme, compatible with Curve Trees, aims for seamless substitution and enhanced security.

recent_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
recent_posts.summary:
- The Fiat channels operate custodially, enabling proof of misbehavior, unlike Tony's non-custodial setup.
- Tony's construction allows BTC and USD channels within the same node, offering swap services directly.
- Emphasizing differences between the two methods is vital for an accurate understanding of LN's ecosystem.

recent_posts.title: Introduction to cluster linearization
recent_posts.summary:
- Cluster linearization aims to enhance Bitcoin Core's efficiency by improving mempool management.
- It involves organizing transactions into clusters for better transaction processing and block creation.
- The approach uses complex algorithms and feerate diagrams to optimize transaction sequencing and fee collection.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests adding quantum resistance to Bitcoin via a new signature algorithm.
- It warns of quantum computing's threat to Bitcoin security, urging immediate action for viability.
- The document invites community feedback on the "QuBit" soft fork draft to enhance quantum defenses.

active_posts.title: Idea for BIP : Deterministic Wallets with Token support
active_posts.summary:
- The surge in Ethereum tokens outpaces wallet structures, compromising privacy.
- Proposed enhancements include using unique token identifiers for key generation.
- This method improves privacy, streamlines management, and enhances security across tokens.

active_posts.title: Public disclosure of 10 vulnerabilities affecting Bitcoin Core < 0.21.0
active_posts.summary:
- The project has implemented a new vulnerability disclosure policy to enhance security.
- A schedule for disclosing software vulnerabilities, starting with version 22.0 in July, is set.
- This approach emphasizes the project's dedication to transparency and user safety.

active_posts.title: Is it time to increase the blocksize cap?
active_posts.summary:
- Practical bitcoin use for daily transactions is becoming unaffordable for low-income individuals.
- The debate on Bitcoin's base layer user suggests a move away from its decentralized ethos.
- The author criticizes Bitcoin's governance, urging a return to its roots for freedom and autonomy.

active_posts.title: Segwit Ephemeral Anchors
active_posts.summary:
- Ephemeral Anchors introduce a key-less output mechanism vulnerable to transaction ID malleability.
- An initial solution using `wsh(OP_TRUE)` was deemed inefficient and expensive.
- A new proposal suggests a more efficient method using bip141 and undefined witness programs.

active_posts.title: Ephemeral Anchors and MEVil
active_posts.summary:
- An anomaly in the "anti-MEVil" mechanism allows manipulation of transaction ordering.
- A case study shows 'Bob' using 'Alice's funds to conflict with another transaction, 'TxD'.
- Anti-DoS rules unintentionally incentivize inflating ephemeral anchor values, affecting transaction validation.

today_in_history_posts.title: Covenant opcode proposal OP_CONSTRAINDESTINATION (an alternative to OP_CTV)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Billy Tetrud introduced the OP_CONSTRAINDESTINATION opcode to limit output destinations.
- OP_CONSTRAINDESTINATION offers more flexibility than OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY for wallet vaults.
- The proposal is on Github, welcoming feedback for improvement and issue identification.

today_in_history_posts.title: Impact of eltoo loss of state
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Payments in eltoo channels risk loss if nodes crash and recover from outdated backups.
- Carol can assist Bob's fund recovery by permitting fund theft if he attempts to claim them first.
- Nodes are encouraged to share or update states upon reconnection to prevent channel closure disputes.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies involve two types: passive (hands-off) and active (hands-on).
- Passive investments may lead to societal issues like asset underutilization and market withdrawal consequences.
- Proposes central banks could stabilize economies using a currency system backed by a deflationary asset like Bitcoin.
